title: Baby Santa and the Lost Letters
features: Only a week until Christmas, and the last delivery of children's Christmas letters to Santa have not arrived at the North Pole!Santa and his elves are ready to finish making presents . . . but where is the last batch of Christmas letters? For the first time in history, the mailbox at the North Pole is empty. If Santa can’t find the missing letters, Christmas will be ruined for children across the world. Just when it seems that all is lost, out jumps Baby Santa. The youngest member of the Claus family relies on his quick wits, his winning attitude, and his endless energy to solve the mystery of the lost letters with help from remarkable animal characters around the globe.Responding to a cry for help, penguins, kangaroos, and even a three-toed sloth cooperate with friends on every continent in an amazing race to save the holidays.With a boundless spirit of cooperation, Baby Santa proves that Christmas is for every living being. Children and their parents will thrill to this exciting holiday adventure guided by the youngest member of the Claus family, Baby Santa.
description: is a radiation oncologist, specializing in the treatment of women's and children's cancer. One of the leaders in her field and the President, Chief Executive Officer, and Owner of OncoLogics, Inc., a group of clinical practices throughout Louisiana, Dr. DeLand has dedicated her career to helping her patients and their families lead balanced and rewarding lives. She is the author of three series of children's books,

is a Pittsburgh based animator and illustrator with over 40 years of professional experience. He has worked in virtually all media, including magazines, greeting cards, posters, billboards, advertisements, and more than sixty children's books. He has created animation for TV specials, music videos, TV commercials and feature films. With a style that ranges from photo-realism to cartoon, Phil has won numerous awards for his work in both film and illustration and has been inducted into two halls of fame.
